episode_title: 905 - The One With Phoebe’s Birthday Dinner

content.description: Central Perk. All except Chandler, plus Emma.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh hey you guys, I couldn’t get a reservation for the night of my birthday, so we have to do dinner Thursday night instead.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thursday? But that’s Halloween.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: [It’s just] So spooky, that’s all.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So, so, is Mike coming to dinner?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! It’s my first birthday with a boyfriend, and he has to work. Uch, I get mad at him, but I think it’s a little to soon to show my true colors.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Pheebs, I would make a reservation for five, because one of us has to stay home and watch Emma. (to Ross:) Which one of us should go to dinner?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, Rachel!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Actually, um, I was thinking maybe both of us could go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yay!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks, I put a lot of extra thoughts on your gift.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Alright, okay, so we can all go now. That is fun. Hey, you know what? We all haven’t been together the six of us in such a long time.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What are you talking about? We’re all together right now.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Um, Mon, Chandler’s not here.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, dear god!

content.description: Tulsa, a conference room. Chandler is chairing a group of eight people.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Good morning everyone, it’s nice to see our team together for the first time. Now, before we get started, are there any questions? (colleague raises hand) Yes, Ken is it?

content.speaker: Ken
content.text: That’s right. Is it true, that the reason you are here in Tulsa is that you fell asleep in a meeting and took the job without realizing what you were saying yes to?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, don’t believe everything you hear, Ken. (both turning away to files) But yeah, that’s true. Alright, let’s get started, by take a look at last quarter’s figures. (The female next to Chandler starts smoking, towards her:) Ah, Claudia, aren’t you supposed to blow smoke up the bosses’ ass?

content.speaker: Claudia
content.text: I’m sorry. Does the smoke bother you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, no, no-no-no. I smoked for years, then I quit. Right now, I can’t remember why. (to everyone:) You’re not allowed to smoke in this office. Not right?

content.speaker: Claudia
content.text: Yes, in Oklahoma it’s legal to smoke in offices with fifteen people or less. (passing the pack) Would you like one?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, lo…look. I don’t smoke anymore. But if the rest of you want to light up, go ahead, it’s fine. (everyone lights up) So you all smoke then? That’s almost rude, that I’m not.

content.speaker: Ken
content.text: That’s not true. If you don’t wanna smoke …

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ken, please! No, I can’t, I can’t smoke. If I smoke, my wife would kill me.

content.speaker: Ken
content.text: I’m sorry, but isn’t your wife back in New York?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I always liked you, Ken. (takes a cigarette)

content.description: The Bings’. Monica in bathrobe, merely covered. Someone’s knocking at the door.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Trick or treat! (It’s obviously Halloween eve, the night of her birthday dinner.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, and treat it is. (Monica’s breasts.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hmhmm. (ties up)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, so glad I changed. Almost wore my ??? outfit that can’t contain my breasts.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: This is not, what I’m wearing. I’m ovulating and Chandler’s gonna be home any minute, so I thought we would try before dinner.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh. Oh wait! (Jis) you guys won’t be late for my dinner, will you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Believe me, Chandler and I have not seen each other in over a week. We’ll probably be the first ones there.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ’kay, see you there. Happy humping! (outside meeting Chandler.) Hey…hey! Oh, wow, somebody smoked out here? Oh my god, don’t people know, you’re not allowed to smoke in public spaces?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Actually, in Oklahoma smoking is legal in all commune areas and offices with fewer than fifteen people.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You smoked!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No! I just happened t’do a lot trivias about smoking in different states. For example, in Hawaii cigarettes are called Leyhallalookoos.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Chandler, you stink of cigarettes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uch, do you think, Monica is gonna be able smell it?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you kidding? The woman has the nose of a bloodhound … and the breasts of a Greek goddess.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Pheebs?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m gonna go. (leaves to stairs)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Okay, something to cover the smell … Oven cleaner! (sprays himself, reads label) Unscented!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Welcome home. I’ve missed you. join me in the bedroom?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No thanks, I’m good.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: O-kay, so you wanna play it that way, do you?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right. You know what? Actually I just get off the plane, so I’m feeling kinda gross. Maybe I should just take a shower.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You don’t need a shower.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Alright, the truth is, I soiled myself during some turbulences.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What do I smell? (sniffs him) I smell smoke. Huh—did you smoke?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, but I just had one. Two. Two tiny cigarettes. Okay, five. A pack. Two pack…a…a carton. Three big fat cartons in two days. (How many cigarettes are there in one pack and how many packs in one carton in the US?) But it’s over, I made a decision, I’m not gonna smoke anymore.

content.speaker: Monica
content.parenthetical: gets a pack out of his jacket

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But, those are for you.

content.description: Ross and Rachel’s. Ross phones, Rachel and Emma are there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Alright, we’ll just, uh, see when you get here. Bye. (hangs up) Huh, that was my mom, she’s stuck in terrible traffic.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, well that’s now the third sign that I should not leave Emma.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, what were the other two?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, let’s see. The first one is: I don’t want to. And, you know, I’m not going.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I know, it’s the first time, we’re leaving the baby and … hey, I know how hard it is for you, but … but Emma is gonna be fine. My mom is gonna be with her. She’s great with kids.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She is?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ya.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What about (?) Monica.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, you only heard Monica’s side of that. That little fatso was a terror.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ish. I just don’t think I can bear it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rachel, I know that you can. And you should.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Uch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really, it would be good for you and in fact, why don’t you, why don’t you go ahead to the restaurant and I will wait for my mom and then I’ll meet you there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh-A.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No, no, really. You should go. Just go! Go! Go out! Really, the world is your oyster. Kick up the heels. Paint the town red. (Slang right?)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You need to learn some new slang.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m serious. C’mon, you should go. Here. (shoves her outside, while she tries to stay) No, uh-uh, just go.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What … Oh! (points inside)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No! No, you know what? (closes the door) You [can’t get in there] (?), the baby’s fine, now squam (?). Yeah, [I told you a|Tell your] story walking. (?)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I was just going to say that I left my keys.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, (door is locked) holy molly are we in a pickle now.

content.description: The restaurant. Phoebe and Joey are sitting alone at a table for six.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Where is everyone? They’re forty minutes late.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know, u-uch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’m starving. I know we were coming here tonight, I ate nothing all day.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What about me, he? Only had one lunch today.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Soo, are we expecting the rest of our party shortly?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yes, they are expected presently. Yeah, yeah um, their arrival is in the offing.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Right. We do have a table for two available, perhaps you would be more comfortable.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, they’re comin’, we’re waitin’ right here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Joseph! (to waiter) Thou needn’t worry, they shan’t be long.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: It’s just that we do have some large parties waiting.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: One really does have a stick up one’s ass. Doesn’t one?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: How can you smoke in this day of age? Do you not seen that ad with a little kid walks to grandpa, it’s chilling.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I messed up, it was a meeting, everybody was smoking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So what? Don’t you have any will power?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Will power? I’ve watch home movies of you eating ding-dongs (?) without taking the tin foil off.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You said that was sexy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: ’kay, look: Can we just drop this? I’m not gonna smoke again.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right, because I forbid you to smoke again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You forbid me?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mhmm.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You know, I flew a long way t see my loving wife? Is she here by the way?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t joke (?) with me, okay? I’m very, very upset right now.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, would you say this was the most upset you could be?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Then, I might as well … (grabs the cigarettes) do this (lights one, exhales). Not really sure what to do now.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, I’ll tell you what we’re gonna do: We are already late for Phoebe’s birthday dinner, so you point out put out that cigarette, we’re gonna put this fight on hold and go have sex.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Fine. What!?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sex! This is the last day I’m ovulating, and when we don’t do it now, we’ll have to wait till next month. (walks towards bedroom)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You serious? (follows)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh yeah!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Right, fine, I’ll do it, but no talking.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Huh, and no cuddling.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And no kissing your neck.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh good, I hate it when you do that

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And lots of kissing your neck.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, well the ??? is not home.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Uch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh-oh, wait, my mother is gonna be here any minute. And she has the keys.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Alright, I can’t, I can’t wait that long. You have to do something—knock that door down!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I would, but I bruise like a peach. Besides, y…you know, everything is gonna be fine. The baby’s sleeping.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What if she jumped out the bassinet?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Can’t hold her own head up, but yeah jumped.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my god, I left the water running.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach you did not leave the water running. Please, just pull yourself together, okay?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ah, did I leave the stove on?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You never cooked since 1996. (Actually Rachel cooked in “609 - TOW Ross Got High”, first aired 1999-11-25.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Is the window open? Because if there’s a window open, a bird could fly in there.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh my god, you know what, yeah, I think you’re right. I think … listen, listen!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ubb.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: A pigeon, a pigeon. (previously scared Rachel turns away) No, no wait, no-no, an eagle flew in. Landed on the stove and caught fire. The baby, seeing this, jumps across the apartment to the mighty bird’s aid. The eagle, however, misconstrues as an act of aggression and grabs the baby on its talon. Meanwhile the faucet fills the apartment with water. Baby and bird still up lays (?) are locked in a death grip, swirling around the whirl pool, that fills the apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Boy, are you gonna be sorry if that’s true.

content.description: The restaurant with still just Phoebe and Joey.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Phoebe & Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: It’s been an hour. ??? be willing to reconsider switching to a smaller table.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe we should just eat now.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: You can’t order until your entire party has arrived. Restaurant policy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Wha-a how about this: Another table leaves, right? But there’s still some food left on their place, okay, what’s the restaurant’s policy about people eatin’ that?

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Estrangement (?).

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But it happens? (waiter leaves) I’m gotta go to the bathroom.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, you can’t go. No-no-no, I can’t hold this table on my own. If they ask me to move, I cave.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: If you ask me to stay, I’ll pee. (leaves)

content.speaker: Maitre D’
content.text: Good evening, Miss. (Phoebe turns her head away) Miss? (from the opposite side) Miss? (she turns again) Miss!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, fine, I’ll move. Alright, you don’t have to manhandle me. (gets up) Where? (he points at a smaller table) Okay. Thank you. Wach.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Finally you guys made it. (looks up, turns left to Phoebe’s chair) Pheebs, who the hell—uhuhh!
content.parenthetical: returns to their old table where elderly people are sitting now, sits

content.description: The Bings’ bedroom, Chandler is undressing, Monica in bed already.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Spend more time with the tie. That’ll make a baby.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I can’t do this. I can’t make luv to you while we’re fighting this way.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh sure, now you’re Mister Sensitivity. But when you wanted to have sex right after my uncle’s funeral

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That was a celebration of life. Alright, look, I’m not gonna do this. Alright, is this really the way you want a baby to be conceived?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No, you’re right. Mnya, we shouldn’t do it like this. Huch. For what it’s worth, I’m, I’m sorry. I shouldn’t have come down on you so hard about the smoking. So you had a few cigarettes, not the end of the world.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Mean it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yah.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You are incredible. Unless, I…I’m not gonna smoke again. And if I do, I promise, I will hide it so much better from you. (they kiss)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: D’you want to?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, let’s celebrate life!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: ’kay.

content.description: Ms. Geller, Rachel and Ross storm into the apartment.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Och, god. (seeing Emma) Oh, thank god, you’re okay. I’m so sorry we left you. Mom never gonna leave you again. Never ever ever again. Uch.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Great. So let’s get going?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh no. I mean it. After what just happened, I’m never leaving her again.

content.speaker: Ms. Geller
content.text: I understand, separation is hard. One time I was about to leave Ross to go to the beauty parlor and he got so upset, he took off all his clothes, tucked his ??? between his legs and cried out: “Mommy, I’m a girl, take me with you.”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Somehow over time it got easier to be apart from you.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uhh. You are welcome.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You know what? Let’s not talk.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uch. I am still so mad at you for smoking.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: But you said you forgave me. It was just a couple of cigarettes—no big deal.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, blablablabaybaybay.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Leave it.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I was just saying that because I was ovulating and you said you wouldn’t have sex with me while we’re fighting.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You tricked me to get me into bed?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: That’s right, I got mine.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I feel so used.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, I guess they’re not coming. You wanna just order?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Thank you. (stands up and kisses her lips.) Waiter! ’lright, this is gonna be fast, so try to keep up: Risotto with the shaped truffles and the roasted rip steak with the golden Chanterelles and a Bordelaise sauce and that any that stuff I just said means snails. (Hope, *I* kept up.)

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Er—does not.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Tomato tart and which of the pastas would you recommend?

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Oh, they’re both exclus…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Both it is, thank you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, uh, again. Can I make a special request: Can you bring everything as soon as it’s ready? Appetizers, entrees, we don’t care.

content.speaker: Ross & Rachel
content.text: Hey, hi, hi!

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: I’ll just wait to put your order in.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys are over an hour late. What happened to you two?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I’m so sorry …

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: We got locked out of the apartment, we …

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s a great story—can I eat it?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: And then Rachel wasn’t sure she could leave the baby.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: N-it wasn’t easy, but it’s your birthday and I did what I got to do.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And that’s Judy over there at the bar with Emma?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh honey, this is for the best, thus I’m not distracted, worrying about Emma, how she’s doing at home and I’m being completely here with you and, oh, she spit up!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: She spit up. Judy! She spi…Judy! Look alive, Judy! (they sit down) Thank you.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks. Oh.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, ooh, everything looks delicious. What should I ha-ave? What should I have?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Never hit a woman. Never hit a woman.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know this ??? is incredible.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ross bruises like a peach. He bruises like a peach.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay, I’ll have the fixed salad and the duck.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yah, I’ll have the soup and the salmon.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And remember whatever comes up first. Okay? And hurry, because …

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Happy birthday!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Son of a bitch!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wher-where have you been?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, we had a little fight.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I would never lie to get someone into bed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You used to tell girls you were a Kennedy. (being sat down) Ooh, uh, thanks. Wow, little tight, isn’t it? How d’you get a bigger table? You-you had a big table, but they made you move. Huh-huh, shut up Monica. Whoo, I suppose that Chandler will have the smoked duck.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I suppose that Monica will have the … manipulative shrew.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: I’ll give you another minute.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Why are you going? He said, she wanted the shrew! (runs after the waiter)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Rach, c’mon, Emma is fine. You’re turning into an obsessive mother. Okay, you need to stop.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Y’guys ever heard the story about when Rosses mom went to the beauty salon?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You mean the lully story?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Huh-huh, they already know it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You guys, we’ve been waiting for you for a long time, maybe you should order.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No, no, it’s okay, I already told the waiter what they want.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Why would you do that?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Chandler, control your woman!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, as everybody has ordered, I would like to start the celebration and make a toast … to Phoebe. She dropped her sock.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Aw … what?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: N-no, Emma dropped her sock.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Mom’s here? I wanted to have lunch with her today, she told me she was out of town.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ross, she still has not noticed that the baby’s sock is on the ground.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: ’s a good toast.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Could you please get her attention?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: W-oa … Mommy! (gestures to his not understanding mother)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, for god’s sake, Judy, pick up the sock! Pick up the sock! Pick up the sock! (everybody scared) I’m sorry, was that rude? Di-did my, my li-little outburst blunt (?) the hideousness (?) that is this evening? Look, I know, you all have a lot going on, but all I wanted to do was have dinner with my friends on my birthday. And you are all so late and you didn’t even have the courtesy to call. (her cellular rings) Well, it’s too late now.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, ??? think that’s us?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: well, this is, this is, this is not over! (on phone) Hello?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, what is going on with you two?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Uch, you see, I’m ovulating.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh yeah, that’s what she says. But maybe you’re not ovulating at all, maybe it’s just a clever ruse to get me into bed.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes smokie, that is what it was. I just can’t get enough.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You not gonna believe this: She lied! She tricked me into having sex with her.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So? Did have sex, right?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s the matter with me? Why I’m such a girl?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, that was Mike.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Phoebe, hi, we’re so sorry. You’re totally right. We are here one hundred per cent and we love you and we are ready to start your birthday celebration.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Mhuh, guys, that means the world to me. Huh, nkay, I’m gonna take off.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, I love you guys too, but Mike got off work early. Wait. Wait, I’m not t—not that kind of girl that just ditches her friends to be with her boyfriend. You know what? I am. Bye guys! (waves to the bar) Judy! Bye.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh thank god, if Phoebe’s going, can we please take Emma home?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You know, I think that’s a good idea—our babysitter just pounded in another Chardonnet. (both get up) Bye, y’guys.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Bye.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: See ya. Well, this is just us.

content.speaker: Monica & Chandler
content.text: Mhum.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: So, I’m, I’m probably still ovulating. Do you want to give it another try?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So you never had sex with a Kennedy, have you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do, do you gonna do it now?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: We don’t have much time. Once the egg descended the oviduct …

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-ohoh. (the Bings leave, the waiter comes)

content.speaker: Maitre D’
content.text: I sincerely hope the rest of your party is returning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nah, just me. All alone. (all the food is served) Dinner for six for one, uh, you boys are about to see something really special.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: How was everything, sir?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Excellent. The shrew in particular was exclusive.

content.speaker: Waiter
content.text: Well, I hope, you got some room left.

content.speaker: Waiters
content.text: Happy birthday to you, happy birthday to you, happy birthday dear …

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Joey! Joey.

content.speaker: Waiters
content.text: … Joey, happy birthday to you.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That’s the best birthday ever.
